pr_title: Add admin delete clusters in project endpoint

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick: I'm not sure the "admin" prefix is too helpful here. We have a pretty strong pattern of calling this member variable "userProvider". I see that locally within this package AuthDomainAuditorImpl also calls it "adminDbUserProvider" (which is probably where this naming came from), but I'd argue both usages are inconsistent with a pretty global pattern across our codebase. It crease more confusion than it resolves IMO, since the "user" is still the "user from the current request context" in all cases.
timeline.author: gjuggler

timeline.bodyText: I'd be inclined to move this towards the bottom of this method, so the audit log is only sent after the Firecloud interactions are completed. Just checking how Jay set this up for other controllers, there seems to be a pretty clear pattern of "do the work first, then fire an audit log".
timeline.author: gjuggler

timeline.bodyText:
The testing pattern here is a bit awkward. What I might have expected to see in a controller-level test would be to make sure all inbound parameters are correctly mapped to the service-level call, e.g.

Set up any required mocks, e.g. when(notebookService).listClustersByProjectAsAdmin(...)
Call the controller method.
Verify that notebookService.deleteClusterAsAdmin was called with BILLING_PROJECT_ID
Verify that clusterAuditor.fireDeleteClustersInProject is called with BILLING_PROJECT_ID
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: Its kinda tricky because all the notebookService stuff is calling to Leo. I will update though.
replies.author: s-rubenstein

replies.bodyText:
I would also like to see these test cases:

clusterNamesToDelete.getClustersToDelete() is null
clusterNamesToDelete.getClustersToDelete() is an empty list
delete some but not all clusters
request to delete cluster(s) which exist but are in a different project
returned cluster status is DELETED (I think there's a bug here)
returned cluster status is in a non-acceptable state
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText:
Talked offline, we are not adding the last two of these test cases because:

With DELETED, we don't want to receive those clusters, because we reuse names, and thus there could be many clusters with the same name in deleted.
We could do the non-acceptable state, but it is just testing logging, and is going to be incredibly messy to maintain that test. (And is sorta testing 'what happens if Leo fails to follow contract')
replies.author: s-rubenstein

replies.bodyText: Might want to blacklist com.google.appengine.repackaged a la https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2009/03/excluding-classes-from-auto-import/
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: This call will skip deleted clusters - see LeonardoNotebooksClientImpl line 155
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Hmmm... I don't think we want to list all deleted clusters though, because we reuse names. We may be okay with this, because clusters probably don't delete that quickly? It will affect return value if they do delete quickly, but won't affect auditing.
replies.author: s-rubenstein

replies.bodyText: agreed offline - we do not want to list deleted
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: This filter block is repeated below, so we can extract it as a small function
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: does not throw Exception - this can actually be removed from every method in this class
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: changing this to CLUSTER_NAMES.length() would make it explicit
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.message: Add admin delete clusters in project endpoint

timeline.bodyText: nit, optional: there's a verifyZeroCalls() (or similar) that can be used instead
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: verifyZeroInteractions() is a mock level method, rather than a method level method (from what I could tell. Sticking with this.
replies.author: s-rubenstein

timeline.bodyText: This is something I was curious about: do we want a missing param (null) to have different semantics from an empty-list param?  We should be explicit about this in the swagger, if so.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: I think we do, because I think not providing a list should give all, but an empty list should behave the same way as any list. I can be more explicit in swagger.
replies.author: s-rubenstein

replies.bodyText: Basically I think there should be some default that says include all clusters, and the body parameter can't be null. We could also do this with a bool on the object that says 'deleteAll' or something, but that seems like extra that we don't need.
replies.author: s-rubenstein
